Question: The psychoanalyst Sigmund Freud drew on this personan psychology, in particular that of Hamlet, for his theories of human nature.
Hints: This person died on 23 April 1616 and was survived by his wife and two daughters.
Rowe was the first biographer to pass down the tradition that this person retired to Stratford some years before his death.
This person's first plays were written in the conventional style of the day.
